intro: Endotropis caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed broom, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features slender, upright stems with clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Endotropis caudata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
